newsitem.title: MEXICO: PRI head rolls after Mexican election upset.
newsitem.headline: PRI head rolls after Mexican election upset.

text.p: The leader of the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI) in the sprawling Mexican capital resigned on Monday, just over a week after his party suffered a stunning setback in mid-term elections.
Roberto Campa Cifrian was the first head to roll after the PRI's worst election setback in 68 years of rule. No replacement was immediately named.

Under Campa's watch, the PRI candidate for mayor of Mexico City, Alfredo del Mazo, was thrashed by Cuauhtemoc Cardenas of the leftist Party of the Democratic Revolution, and the PRI lost all Federal District seats in the lower house of Congress.
Until this year, the ruler of Mexico City had been hand-picked by the president. It is considered one of the most influential jobs in the country.
In the July 6 elections, the PRI also lost its majority in the lower house of Congress for the first time since it was founded in 1929.
